Enum Class WallHeatTransferModel

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<WallHeatTransferModel>
neqsim.fluidmechanics.flownode.fluidboundary.heatmasstransfercalc.WallHeatTransferModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<WallHeatTransferModel>, Constable
public enum WallHeatTransferModel extends Enum<WallHeatTransferModel>
Enum for selecting wall heat transfer models in two-phase pipe flow simulations.

Different thermal boundary conditions are available for different use cases:

  • CONSTANT_WALL_TEMPERATURE - Isothermal pipes with fixed wall temperature
  • CONSTANT_HEAT_FLUX - Electric heating or constant heating/cooling rate
  • CONVECTIVE_BOUNDARY - Subsea pipelines with heat transfer to surroundings
  • ADIABATIC - Perfectly insulated pipes with no heat transfer
Author:
NeqSim development team

  • Enum Constant Details

    • CONSTANT_WALL_TEMPERATURE

      public static final WallHeatTransferModel CONSTANT_WALL_TEMPERATURE
      Constant wall temperature boundary condition. The wall temperature is fixed at a specified value: T_wall = T_const. Suitable for isothermal pipes or pipes with high thermal mass.

    • CONSTANT_HEAT_FLUX

      public static final WallHeatTransferModel CONSTANT_HEAT_FLUX
      Constant heat flux boundary condition. A fixed heat flux is applied at the wall: q'' = q''_const. Suitable for electric heating or controlled heating/cooling.

    • CONVECTIVE_BOUNDARY

      public static final WallHeatTransferModel CONVECTIVE_BOUNDARY
      Convective boundary condition with heat transfer to surroundings. Heat transfer is calculated using an overall heat transfer coefficient: q'' = U_overall * (T_ambient - T_fluid). Suitable for subsea pipelines and buried pipes.

    • ADIABATIC

      public static final WallHeatTransferModel ADIABATIC
      Adiabatic boundary condition with no heat transfer through the wall. The wall is perfectly insulated: q'' = 0. Suitable for well-insulated pipes or short pipe sections.
